Cancels a job in an Batch job queue

Source: R/batch_operations.R
batch_cancel_job.Rd

Cancels a job in an Batch job queue. Jobs that are in the SUBMITTED, PENDING, or RUNNABLE state are canceled. Jobs that have progressed to STARTING or RUNNING aren't canceled, but the API operation still succeeds, even if no job is canceled. These jobs must be terminated with the terminate_job operation.

batch_cancel_job(jobId, reason)

Arguments

jobId

[required] The Batch job ID of the job to cancel.

reason

[required] A message to attach to the job that explains the reason for canceling it. This message is returned by future describe_jobs operations on the job. This message is also recorded in the Batch activity logs.

Value

An empty list.

Request syntax

svc$cancel_job(
  jobId = "string",
  reason = "string"
)

Examples

if (FALSE) {
# This example cancels a job with the specified job ID.
svc$cancel_job(
  jobId = "1d828f65-7a4d-42e8-996d-3b900ed59dc4",
  reason = "Cancelling job."
)
}
